author: lasky6
title: Cool new Droid Ship
review:
this set was $19.99 when i found it at a tru. the rocket battle droids are really cool.
pros
rocket battle droids
jet packs
good for buildig space fleets

cons
i think its wierd to have 2 heads

overall if you can find this set its worth picking up

author: demasoni
title: Nice little droid set
review: This is one of the smaller sets out there but if you love droids then you should like this one. It is nicely designed and the wings can be set in different positions . It inexpensive and has good play value, overall worth getting.

author: newlegoset333
title: WAY huge, and way cool!
review:
I bought this set during the Winter 2009 Clone Wars wave at my local TRU. It still hasn't appeared in the Clone Wars TV series yet, but that doesn't mean it's not worth buying!

Pros: Really huge! Bigger then the AAT in size.
3 Rocket battle droids (They are the color of Obi-Wan's hair)
3 "heads." There are 2 on the top (only one moves,) and on the bottom there is a spy head, with one eye.
Working "bombs."

Cons: Legs break off every once and a while.
Falls over and breaks if it isn't perfectly balanced.

Over all, this is a great addition for anyone's collection!

author: comandercody654
title: A lot bigger than I thought it would be.
review:
THE BUILD: You can build this set in 30 minutes and it will look awesome
THE BOMBER:IT can drop 4 bombs
                        The hyena is huge!
                        The two heads are awesome
 THE DROIDS: The new brownish droids are very unique looking 
                         They can stand on the hyena
 THE COST: 19.99 at both the lego store and tru
 THE 'ONE' CON: needs some jet troopers >w<

author: clone_commander_trainrex
title: Awesome droid ship
review: This is so much fun.  I got it At TRU for 20 usd.  The rocket droids are so cool and the bombs are fun to launch.  The stickers are so cool and set in perfect spots.  Overall it is definatly worth 20.00.  The twisting legs are nice too.

author: Tim_Bit
title: Better Than expected.
review:
When the first images surfaced of this set many said it looked awful. But I knew it would be great.
Pros:
-New Droids
-lots of slopes
-bomb dropping mechanism
-olny decently priced Clone Wars set
Cons:
-when the wings are folded its a bit bulky.
Hope it helped.

author: wyoeaglefan
title: Good price, neat little fighter
review:
I'm only giving this a 4 because it seems like we get vulture droids all the time, and basically this is just one oversized vulture droid.

The bomb dropping mechanism works well, and is simple, the ship is actually about three times the size of the smaller vulture droids. I think Lego is giving us a break on pricing because this one is about perfect at $20. The little jump jet droids are alright, but they're basically just special colored battle droids with binoculars on their back.

It's a fun set to swoosh, and in the cool CIS colors it looks nice alongside a few blue vulture droids. I'd say go ahead and pick one up for $20.

author: Trandoshan
title: An awesome buy with a great price/part ratio!
review:
I remember first seeing this set on brickshelf a couple of months ago, I've always loved vulture droids and thought this was pretty cool, but didn't intend to buy it, but later when flicking through my lego catolog I saw that it was only 26 CAD and knew I had to buy it, so on tuesday I picked this and the clone battle pack up at the local Wal-mart. Now to the review-

Construction:

Pros:
Fairly detailed instructions, easy and quick to build.

Cons:
All the markings in this set is a sticker, some of them rather large.
Easy and quick to build.

Play value:

Pros:
Very swooshable, stands up easily.
I was very surprised at how much I enjoyed the "bomb dropping" play feature, going so far as to bomb my dog.

Cons:
There isn't anything for it to battle.

Minifigs:

Pros:
The minifigs are clearly pictured and are fairly cool with their binocular "jetpacks" and they have pieces in rare colours.




Overall rating: 9/10

author: ian
title: TALL DARK AND HANDSOME
review:
The title says it all I picked it up at Top 1 toys along with the stone chopper
and it is WORTH THE PRICE! it can drop bombs and convert into walker mode like all vulture droids and i'ts taller than any set I own! you can even fit a regular vulture droid under it! And the rocket droids rule! lets see some pros and PROS and CONS

PROS
i'ts huge
has a good price
CIS coulers
can drop bombs
has 3 heads
ROCKET DROIDS!
sturdy

CONS

legs break every now and then.


OVERALL an amazing set you should buy it.

author: shinjix2
title: The bomber has bombed....
review:
Well, after I put this set together I just didn't get much of an "awe" from it like other sets. Maybe because at the time, I haven't seen this fighter in action from the Clone Wars Series. Several cons are evident throughout the new lego sets so I won't hold them against this set.

Pros:
The new minifigs, Makes the set worth buying
Bombing system is impressive
The amount of movable parts

Cons:
Applying your own stickers
Price (should be $5 less)
Some parts that move, I'm not sure why
Not very sturdy

author: Speninator
title: Pretty good...
review:
This set is the first set I got based off the starwars tv show.This set has great play, well-working features and 3 rocket battle droids.

PROS
You can drop the bombs!
Those battle droids are a good addition
no flick-fire missiles! Yippee!
Transforms quickly.

CONS
wings fall off pretty easy
Why can you move the position of the top parts?!?!

Personally,  I think you should only buy this if you have another set to bomb, or if you have more droids for it to fight with.

author: legoreviewer
title: Cool...
review:
I like this set. It's not amazing but it's pretty cool. I like the new jet droids.


Minifigs: I really like the jet droids in this set. The idea was from the Clone Wars series on cartoon network. Nothing much more to be said than that.

Build: Pretty easy and quick. Took me about 30 minutes to complete. The only flaw is the legs are hard to position when trying to stand the vulture. And they sometimes all off.

Finished Product: Looks nice but not very sturdy. I do like the bomb dropping function although they are difficult to put back in.

Overall: A cool set and a good addition to a droid army. 4/5

Correction: This is not a hyena droid. What the heck is a hyena droid? I consider this a vulture droid.

author: captain_radda_radda
title: Roger Roger
review:
This set is AWESOME! I picked it up at target yesterday and was blown away. The set is big for 20 dollars. It is also taller than the twilight and republic gunship when it stands up. 

Pros:
BIG
TALL
cool minifigs
awesome color sceme

Cons:
NONE!

This set goes great with any droid army!

author: jjr
title: nice medium set
review:
again I wanted to buy a new star wars set, this one was one of the last ones at my "to buy" list,

building: this part is really fun, sometimes a little bit boring and the stickers gave me the feel I was at school (boring) but the final product is nice

playability: ofcourse the main function is to drop bombs. the rest is also fun, like the droids flying down to infiltrate a republic base. but maybe a clone with a jetpack would be better

price: for 30 euro it's a little to expensive, but still it's a nice set. and you got 3 exclusive droids with it.

overal: a very good set, but i just don't liek the overall design, I bought it for my vulture droid collection (have almost all CIS space ships by now) and it's a nice adition, not a great one however

author: THX_1138
title: Better than expected.
review:
When I saw the prelim pics back in late 2008, this was one of the sets I was least impressed with. Not that I though it looked bad, I just didn't think it looked as good as most of the others. I got this thinking it would probably be okay, but not great. It turned out to be better than I had expected.

Pros:
-Huge.
-Great looking in flight modes.
-Good colors.
-Looks good with other Separatist vehicles.
-Pretty sturdy.
-The rocket droids have cool colors.

Cons:
-The walking mode isn't all that good.
-Lots of stickers, which would leave the model quite plain looking if not applied (I don't mind stickers, but most fans do).

This is a good set, and looks great with the Separatist vehicles that have been released now and should look good with 2010's Tri-fighter.

author: P13c30fch33s3
title: A useful addition to any CIS (Droid) Army
review:
This set seems like an up-size of the Vulture Droid because it has the same basic shape:
=> Curve disc front
=> Same wing pieces
=> Same basic head design
Anyway, onto the actual review...

Battle Droids + Jetpacks:
These are basically battle droids with 2 extra pieces. Nothing special, but they are (relatively) episode-accurate in terms of colour.

Bombs:
The bombs are rather simple to make and also use a very simple mechanism to drop them. Even so, the bombs drop neatly after the first three tries (that was for me).

Heads:
There are three heads, two of which can move. One is on the bottom of the non-moving one. The two heads that can move do not swivel. Although it is a shame, it would be hard to adapt the heads to swivel, and it would make it more fragile.

Wings:
These are basically like the Vulture Droid wings made bigger. The (very small) section that holds the wings to the main base is slightly weak. The 2*1 1/3 piece on the back sometimes pops off when you try to move the wings. The wings move smoothly from flight/fight position to landing/walker position.

Main Base:
The main disc-shaped section is quite sturdy. It also holds everything else (except the droids) together.

Bomb Mechanism:
The bomb mechanism is just a few technic sticks held forward by a rubber band. This allows the bomb mechanism to keep the bombs in place.

Pros:
Fairly sturdy (Not built for a trip down wooden stairs)
3 Batle Droids (Always a welcome addition)
Stands Properly (Nothing much worse than a failed attempt)
Bomb mechanism works (unlike other unfortunate failures)
Looks (relatively) episode-accurate

Cons:
Nowhere for the droids to go (they would probably get blasted in three minutes or less...)
Bombs sometimes wobble in sockets (although not much of a problem)

Conclusion:
A useful set to get. It will reinforce your droid army and give you 3 unique minifigs.
PS: I have a feeling that other people's Hyena Bombers were less fortunate and had more problems than mine. Please don't kill me if this review proves inaccurate...

author: I_like_Lego
title: Okay set but no vader
review:
I bought this set because it was heavier then another hyena droid bomber,(Thanks Mandolorian canditat for the tip on weight)so i bought it,when i got home and there was no CHROME VADER i went on building maybe i picked up the wrong one? After i finished building my dad put on the stickers.

PROS:
.nice hyena droid bomber,nice minifigs
.Nice bombing mecanism 
.Great Rocket droids but they don't look like the one's from the TV series
.I like the Rocket Droids jet packs
.Stickers look nice on model
.The hyena droids head the one with eyes look really cool especially the one under the second head
.New bigger blue rubber band
.I like the wings

CONS:
.Read the instructions CAREFULLY when making the wings or you will end up like me(Two wings a little longer one a little higher up).
.Bombs are hard to put back in
.Wings come off easily,head comes off easily
.NO CHROME VADER! :(

author: HersheyBearsHockey1938
title: Awesome Separatist craft
review: Alright, we've all seen Vulture Droids before, and this set takes the principals of the Vulture and takes them to a different level. Unfortunately it would be that there's only one feature: four dropping bombs. These are easy to use and fun to drop, though the sole catch can be replacing them into their holders. Despite this, the fighter itself is pretty sturdy like its smaller Vulture counterparts and holds together well and is fun to have for your Republic vehicles to get bombed and for them to shoot this one down. The rocket pack battle droids are also neat to have for air fights if you have the Tank Droid set. Overall, a very nice enemy craft.

author: greshmalum
title: Great set
review:
The Hyena Droid Bomber has many features. As with the Vulture Droid, it has a lot of poseability, walking/standing and flying, but it's actually more poseable. The minifigures are great, the first out of two releases. The 'brain' is cool and can move up and down. The 'brain'ish thing on the right is cool too, I think it controls the bombs. There are four bombs. Each pair has its own thing you pull back to launch the two.

 

Pros~

  • Rocket Battle Droid minifigures- three!
  • poseability
  • 'swooshability'
  • 'brain'
  • bomb launcher

Cons~

  • none come to mind

author: kaboomlegoman
title: Wow!
review:
This set is really a good buy. The bomb dropping function works really well, and now you can bomb the Republic anytime!


Minifigures: 6/10. They're new, but really there just doesn't feel like anything new.


Building: 9/10. I love all the Technic entries within. It makes it really enjoyable.


Pieces: 5/10. The pieces aren't new.


Design: 9/10. Like I said, the Technic for the bombs are really cool.


Playability: 10/10. All the functions work brilliantly, and there's a storage hatch in the back, but TLC is just too dumb to show it. :). The bombs are activated by pulling two Technic levers on the back, and it works really well, like I said.


Price: 9/10. All I can say is standard.


Overall:48/60 . I don't really use the hatch in the back for anything, and it's really breakable, but it's really a good pick in the end. I hope you get this and you're a fan of my reviews and bricklists! Ever read, "YOU MUST DIE!!"? :).

author: ggggggggggggggggggggggggg
title: great set!
review:
This is a great set and it definitly does not break easily, the bomb dropping mechanism is great although you cant drop more than one at once.

Pros
minifigs
bomb dropping mechanism
wings
useful parts for MOCing
the secound cockpit
play ability

cons
you cant drop 1 bomb at once

Overall I think this is a great set and really suggest you get it

author: ekruzz
title: Not meant to be played with.
review: This thing is always breaking in some fashion, even with the most delicate handling. It's rather frustrating. In addition, 3 missing parts! This is the first time i've ever had that happen in 25+ years of collecting/owning any Lego set.

author: Bookworm
title: fly, droids, fly
review:
I really like the jetpack droids in this set. the colour scheme on them is great. on the bomber itself, the head dosent rotate like it says on the box. The bombs are cool but the mechanism dosent work very well and the bombs are hard tko put back on.

PROS:
Droids
colour scheme
good price, only 40AUD
 rare minifigs

CONS:
Bomb dropper
Head dosent rotate

a pretty good set

author: legoDad42
title: NICE SHIP! BUT could be better...
review:
Overall, this is another good Star Wars kit from Lego. 

There are definite 'pro's' but some improvement is needed. 
For instance the color scheme of the dark grey brick against the dark blue need some lighter grey bricks (ala the Armored Assault Tank) for a nicer look. 
Also, too many stickers which could be replaced with unique brick parts. 

PRO'S - 4 bombs (which use a simple clever mechanism for dropping-a rubberband attachment when pulled back drops the bombs quite well), Wings that open/close and tilt to a walker vehicle, tilting bridge sections, 3 jet pack Battle Droids. 

Cons.-Too many stickers, color scheme. 

This set usually gets a bad rap, but it's a nice edition to your 'droid' army. Has a nice look in flight mode and when you tilt the wings down and open them adds to the playability.
Also this set can be considered a Battle Pack since both vehicle and mini-figs are all Droids.

author: thewish
title: Meh.
review:
Hyena Droid Bombers were seen the Clone Wars TV seriues in the episode where Windu and the Ryloth resistance movement attack Wat Tambor's forces in the capital. This ship is probably my least favourite in my collection. I got it for a cheap price (£20) and it does come with three never-seen-before figures, but the cons outweigh the pros.

PROS-
Three Rocket Droid figures
Bomb system work well

CONS-
No laser cannons (what?!)
RBDs impossible to stand up
Falls over easily
Breaks easily
Limited playability

If you want it, get it. Simple. But it's not great.

author: LEGOwikiguy
title: Bombers fly to destroy the clones...
review:
This is a set that is really good if you don't own a Droid Gunship or another Droid bomber. The rocket droids are really good, especially the new colors. I give this set a 4/5, because, in my opinion, the set should have someone to fight, such as a Clone Trooper or a Pod. Pros and Cons, here they come...

Pros:
1. Bomber is like a double Droid Starfighter
2. This can actually bomb those Clones fighting below...
3. Includes new rocket droids
4. Wings can turn into legs

Cons:
1. Can fall apart a bit, but otherwise pretty sturdy
2. Alone, nothing much to do with it

I don't love this set alot, but do recommend this set to anyone. Parents, your child will most likely need help building this set if under 8. Hope this review helps!

author: thejoker34
title: If the bombers were built like this in the movie the clones wouldn't have to barely try to blow them up
review:
Before I start...this is so fragile. I hate fragile sets and if you do to don't get this set. 
Minifigs: Rocket Battle Droid: 10/10. These are some cool droids with their orange torsos to their jetpacks. You get three of these awesome minifigures.

Bomber: The Bombs are a neat feature but every single thing falls off all the time. It's unsturdy and some of the pieces don't go on well. I wouldn't recomend this set to anyone who likes to PLAY with their sets.

author: Legend234
title: Quite good.
review:
This set is okay but it could do with some improvement. For instance when you try to change the wings round to stand it up they sometimes come apart and when you're building it there are too many stickers instead of printed bricks. I also found it strange that there were no blasters just bombs, so I added my own.

Now the good things, I really like the mechanism that drops the bombs, all you have to do is pull this lever (For lack of a better word) and you drop the bombs. It comes with 4 bombs altogether and you can drop all of them at once or two at a time. I also like how you can move the head and the tracker head thing underneath. 

Now pro's and con's

Pros:
Rocket battle droids
Bomb mechanism
Moving wings
Bomber can stand
Moving head and tracker

Cons:
Wings break off sometimes
Too many stickers

Overall a good set but could be improved.

author: BRICKBOY74
title: Display only
review: this set falls apart very esaly I am not satisfied with the set.The wings or legs fall of very esaly.This set is mostly ment for display in my opinion.The amo is a little hard to put in and to launch.

author: Legoboy01
title: Rocket Battle Droids.
review:
It is a very fun set to play with!I keep dropping it by accident
and the legs keep falling off.The rocket battle droids are AMAZING!I like the bombs underneath.The bombs drop really good!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Hyena Droid Bomber
review:
The Hyena Droid Bomber set (8016) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2009. It comes with 3 minifigs and 232 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8016-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:

Rocket Battle Droid (3x): Set 8016 is the first set which comes with rocket battle droids. These figures are basic battle droids with an orange head and torso. The arms and the legs are dark gray. On the back you can see a dark gray stud with a pair of binoculars. All 3 minifigs come with a blaster.

Hyena Droid Bomber:

The hyena droid bomber is a very neat set. We get 2 heads. One can lift up and down but it won't sviwel to the left or to the right. The wings can be folded out and you can put that model in attack mode. On the bottom is a lever which you can use if you want to drop the bombs. There're 4 bombs in this set. This set is a very nice additon to your droid army.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Great army builder
Price
Play features


Negative:

Stickers

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: fox171171
title: Interesting set. A lot of stickers (which sucks).
review:
An interesting build. Slight repetitiveness in the wing construction.

A lot of stickers in this set, and I always find stickers disappointing. Some sets look okay if you choose not to apply the stickers, but this one would not be very good without them, particularly the "face". Some stickers are close together and alignment is therefore quite important, and that is why I rated the build experience a little lower.

You can never have too many battle droids, and the different colored rocket droids is a nice addition to my "army". The plastic seems different, hopefully more durable than my old ones (many of which will not stand up or keep their heads up any more, despite being exclusively display pieces).

There is a conflict in construction, comparing the pictures of it to the construction instructions. Not a big deal, it works either way.

Displays well in walking mode with other droids. Looks a little odd in bomber mode in my opinion.

author: ARCommando
title: Good for a gallery
review:
This set is very good but i had the legs falling off all the time and it just seemed fragile



Pros:
Good details and the dropping "bombs" are a good detail

some rare and uncommen pieces

Cons:
The legs kept falling off mine
the droids jet packs are simple and to basic

author: puCrepeaP
title: Well, at least i didn't pay much for it.
review:
There really is very little about this set that I like.  It's saving grace is that it is relatively inexpensive.

The build was ok.  I like the moving parts.  I'm a sucker for sets that convert form one shape to another, this one fits the bill there.

But that's about where the good things end for me.

I don't like the unsymetric-ness of it.  Maybe this is more on Star Wars than on Legos, but the rockets aren't centered, and the piece that moves up from the top (i really don't know the function of this) is only on one side.

I don't like the many stickers that came with it.  Everything is stickered, and if not put on just right the stickers don't flow from one side to the other.

Even though I like the moving parts like the legs, I do't like the construction itself.  It seems weak, and bound to fall apart when playing.

I don't like that this thing doesn't really have any sort of cockpit.  I guess it's an entity in itself, being a droid as well and not a ship, but the design of it screams ship.  It's flat and uninspired, seems like there is little room for a brain if it is infact a droid.

And the minifigs are boring.  3 droids that are really uninteresting in how they are put together.

I like it because it's cheap, and it's LEGO Star Wars.  But I seem no reason to recommend it to anyone.

author: HUNLegoD
title: Unique set for low price.
review:
Since so many quality reviews were added, i'm going to write this one in hungarian for the diversity.

Különleges, írtam a bevezetoben, pedig nem egy hatalmas, sok elembol álló csomag.
A különlegessége a "kiállásában" van. Remekül mutat a szett, mindkét állásában.

Az összeállítás nem a legélvezetesebb, de ez a számomra érthetetlen matricák miatt van. Nyomtatnak elore matricázott elemeket is, emiatt nem értem miért kell megadni az esélyt, hogy az ember elrontsa a hon áhított szettet.
A kék-szürke színvilág idotálló. A minifigurák bár egyeznek, mégis kapunk valami egyedit a megszokott "homok"-barna katonáktól.
Speciális elem nincs sok benne, viszont a technic elemek itt nem nagyon kirívóak és csak a szárnyak tövében láthatóak. A négy narancs színu bomba szuperül mutat és feldobja a megjelenést, kapunk egy rövid gumigyurut amivel ki tudjuk oldani azokat.
A hiéna-droid feje két állásban állhat, repülés közben belesimul a testbe. Kiemelve elválik a síktól és igazi fejet mutat, sajnos a filmben látott jobbra-balra mozgásokra nem képes. 

Én nem vagyok a vitrinek híve, éppen ezért a függesztést szoktam választani. Ez a Lego remekül és nagyon sokféle szögben lógatható fel. Repülési módban, orral elore fele döntve is mutat a legjobban.

Kevés elem jó pénzért. Összefoglalásként nem lehetne sokkal többet elmondani, megéri megvenni és az 5-ös (hibás vétel - nem tetszik - tetszik - nagyon tetszik - különösen ajánlott) értékelésben

TETSZIK.

D.

author: pitcovich
title: This set is not nearly as bad as people say it is....but could still be better
review:
This set is not a bad set, people say that this is one of the worst lego Star Wars sets of all time. I like this set and it is fun to play with but it could still be better, now let's get started!

-building experience, this set is not small but it does not have very many pieces. It has some stickers which make the model look good but the build is quick and there is not much to say about it.

-parts, this set includes 3 rocket battle droids which you can only get in this set and the droid tri-fighter (set 8086) and they are very cool with the geonosian head and body and the gray arms and legs. This set has nice dark blue pieces but not much else to say about the parts.

-Playability, This set is pretty fun to play with, the droid head can move up and down but not side to side. The wings can fold and bend to put it into fly mode. You can release the bombs by pulling back a handle on the bottom of the ship, releasing 2 at a time.

-Overall thoughts, this is a good set and was cheap at the time, but despite everyone hating on this set I recommend this set for collectors and kids if you can find it at a good price.
